text: Anton "Donyo" Kuzmanov (, born 28 March 1918) was a Bulgarian footballer. ==Club career== Donyo Kuzmanov played in a prestigious Bulgarian club FC Shipka SofiaAnton Kuzmanov at Worldfootball.com reaching with them the third place in the 1937–38 Bulgarian championship. After winning the 1939 Bulgarian Cup Final he moved to Yugoslavia and joined Serbian club SK Jedinstvo Beograd. He was registered for Jedinstvo in November 1939."Sportski vesnik" n242, 22 November 1939, page 1, He was coached by Bane Sekulić."Футболната романтика на България - Fudbalska romantika Bugarija" by Silvestar Milchev, pages 82 and 83, He also played with Jedinstvo in the 1940–41 Serbian League scoring one goal.1940/41 season data at parapsihopatologija.com ==International career== On 2 October 1938, in Sofia, he played for the Bulgarian national team in a friendly match against Germany.Anton Kuzmanov at EU-Football.info ==References== Category:1918 births Category:Bulgarian footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:FC Shipka Sofia players Category:First Professional Football League (Bulgaria) players Category:SK Jedinstvo Beograd players Category:Yugoslav First League players Category:Expatriate footballers in Yugoslavia Category:Possibly living people
title: Anton Kuzmanov
